signals.name: Malfunction indicator lamp
signals.description: The MIL status is OFF during key-on, engine-off bulb check unless MIL has also been commanded ON for a detected malfunction. The status reflects whether there are confirmed DTC(s) stored that are illuminating the MIL. It should not reflect the status of the MIL, which could be on for a function check, flashing I/M readiness or flashing for misfire.

signals.name: Number of DTCs stored in this ECU
signals.description: Number of confirmed emission-related DTCs stored in the ECU available for display using Service $03.

signals.name: Compression ignition monitoring supported
signals.description: Indicates support of spark ignition or compression ignition monitors.

signals.name: DTC that caused required freeze frame data storage
signals.description: 0 indicates no freeze frame data.

1.description: Open loop - has not yet satisfied conditions to go closed loop

2.description: Closed loop - using oxygen sensor(s) as feedback for fuel control

4.description: Open loop due to driving conditions (e.g. power enrichment, deceleration enleanment)

8.description: Open loop - due to detected system fault

16.description: Closed loop, but fault with at least one oxygen sensor - may be using single oxygen sensor for fuel control

32.description: Open loop - has not yet satisfied conditions to go closed loop (Bank 2)

64.description: Open loop due to driving conditions (Bank 2) (e.g. power enrichment, deceleration enleanment, cylinder deactivation)

128.description: Open loop - due to detected system fault (Bank 2)

1.description: Open loop - has not yet satisfied conditions to go closed loop

2.description: Closed loop - using oxygen sensor(s) as feedback for fuel control

4.description: Open loop due to driving conditions (e.g. power enrichment, deceleration enleanment)

8.description: Open loop - due to detected system fault

16.description: Closed loop, but fault with at least one oxygen sensor - may be using single oxygen sensor for fuel control

32.description: Open loop - has not yet satisfied conditions to go closed loop (Bank 2)

64.description: Open loop due to driving conditions (Bank 2) (e.g. power enrichment, deceleration enleanment, cylinder deactivation)

128.description: Open loop - due to detected system fault (Bank 2)

signals.name: Calculated engine load
signals.description: Represents the amount of work the engine is doing. Expected to reach 100% at wide open throttle/wide open pedal at any altitude, temperature or rpm for both naturally aspirated and boosted engines. If engine load is limited for powertrain protection e.g. engine/turbocharger protection, this value may not reach 100%. For hybrid vehicles, indicates the torque produced only by the internal combustion engine, not the torque being delivered by the entire powertrain. For electric vehicles, the meaning of this parameter is undefined.

signals.name: Engine coolant temperature
signals.description: Your engine temperature must operate within a certain temperature range to operate efficiently and safely. If it runs too hot, then your engine could be permanently damaged. If it runs too cold, then your engine will use more fuel than necessary.

signals.name: Short term fuel trim (bank 1)
signals.description: Correction being used by the closed-loop fuel algorithm.

signals.name: Short term fuel trim (bank 2)
signals.description: Correction being used by the closed-loop fuel algorithm.

signals.name: Short term fuel trim (bank 4)
signals.description: Correction being used by the closed-loop fuel algorithm.

signals.name: Timing advance
signals.description: Ignition timing spark advance for the first cylinder. Measured in degrees before dead center. Minus is degrees before dead center, positive is degrees after.

signals.name: Air flow rate from mass air flow sensor
Absolute throttle position
signals.description: Throttle position at idle will usually be more than 0%, and throttle position at wide open throttle will usually be less than 100%.

2.description: Downstream of first catalytic converter inlet

signals.name: OBD requirements to which vehicle is designed

16.description: Heavy duty vehicles (EURO EEC) C (gas engines)

23.description: Heavy Duty Euro OBD Stage I without NOx Control

24.description: Heavy Duty Euro OBD Stage I with NOx Control

25.description: Heavy Duty Euro OBD Stage II without NOx Control

26.description: Heavy Duty Euro OBD Stage II with NOx Control

34.description: OBD, OBD II and HD OBD
34.value: OBD, OBD II and HD OBD

57.description: Light Duty ZEV, CARB ACC-II and EPA Tier 4 (GTR 22)

signals.name: Time since engine start
signals.description: Increments while the engine is running. Freezes if the engine stalls. Resets to zero during every control module power-up and when entering the key-on, engine off position. Limited to 65,535 seconds and will not wrap around to zero.

signals.name: Distance travelled while MIL was activated
signals.description: Resets to zero when MIL changes from deactivated to activated, if diagnostic information is cleared, or if at least 40 warm-up cycles occur without MIL being activated.

signals.name: Fuel pressure relative to manifold vacuum
signals.description: Fuel rail pressure at the engine when the reading is referenced to manifold vacuum (relative pressure).

signals.name: Fuel rail pressure
signals.description: Fuel rail pressure at the engine when the reading is referenced to atmosphere (gage pressure).

signals.name: Lambda value, Equivalence Ratio Bank 1, Sensor 1
Wide Range O2S Voltage, O2 Sensor Bank 1, Sensor 1
Number of warm-ups since diagnostic trouble codes cleared
signals.description: Number of OBD warm-up cycles since all DTCs were cleared (via an external test equipment or possibly, a battery disconnect). A warm-up is defined in the OBD regulations to be sufficient vehicle operation such that coolant temperature rises by at least 22°C (40°F) from engine starting and reaches a minimum temperature of 70°C (160°F) (60°C (140°F) for diesels). This PID is not associated with any particular DTC. It is simply an indication for inspection/maintenance, of the last time an external test equipment was used to clear DTCs. If greater than 255 warm-ups have occurred, this parameter will remain at 255 and not wrap to zero.

signals.name: Distance traveled since diagnostic trouble codes cleared
signals.description: Distance accumulated since DTCs were cleared (via an external test equipment or possibly, a battery disconnect). This parameter is not associated with any particular DTC. It is simply an indication for inspection/maintenance, of the last time an external test equipment was used to clear DTCs. If greater than 65,535 km have occurred, will remain at 65,535 km and not wrap to zero.

signals.name: Evap system vapor pressure
signals.description: The pressure signal is normally obtained from a sensor located in the fuel tank or a sensor in an evaporative system vapor line.

signals.name: Barometric pressure
signals.description: Normally obtained from one of a dedicated barometric sensor, a MAP sensor at key-on and during certain modes of driving, or inferred from a MAF sensor and other inputs during certain modes of driving. The control module reports BARO from whatever source it is derived from.

signals.name: Control module voltage
signals.description: Power input to the OBD control module. VPWR is normally battery voltage, less any voltage drop in the circuit between the battery and the control module.

signals.name: Commanded equivalence ratio
signals.description: Fuel systems that utilize conventional oxygen sensor display the inverse of the commanded open loop equivalence ratio (also known as lambda) while the fuel control system is in open loop. Will indicate 1.000 while in closed-loop fuel.

signals.name: Relative throttle position
signals.description: Relative or 'learned' throttle position.

signals.name: Time run by the engine while MIL was activated
signals.description: Resets to zero when MIL changes from deactivated to activated, if diagnostic information is cleared, or if at least 40 warm-up cycles occur without MIL being activated.

signals.name: Engine run time since diagnostic trouble codes cleared
signals.description: Time accumulated since DTCs were cleared (via an external test equipment or possibly, a battery disconnect). This parameter is not associated with any particular DTC. It is simply an indication for inspection/maintenance, of the last time an external test equipment was used to clear DTCs. If greater than 65,535 km have occurred, will remain at 65,535 minutes and not wrap to zero.

signals.name: Alcohol fuel percentage
signals.description: Indicates the percentage of alcohol contained in ethanol or methanol fuels, if used. For example, ethanol fuel (E85) normally contains 85% ethanol, in which case this parameter will display 85%

signals.description: Normally obtained from a sensor located in the fuel tank or a sensor in an evaporative system vapor line.

signals.name: Evap system vapor pressure (wide)
signals.description: The pressure signal is normally obtained from a sensor located in the fuel tank or a sensor in an evaporative system vapor line.

signals.description: Fuel rail pressure at the engine when the reading is referenced to atmosphere (gage pressure).

signals.name: Hybrid battery pack remaining charge
signals.description: The percent remaining level of charge for a battery pack used for propulsion, expressed as a percentage of total useable battery energy, commonly referred to as State Of Charge (SOC).

signals.name: Fuel injection timing
signals.description: Start of main fuel injection relative to Top Dead Center (TDC). Positive degrees indicate before TDC, negative degrees indicate after TDC.

signals.name: Engine fuel rate
signals.description: Measured in units per hour

signals.name: Commanded wastegate A position
signals.description: If an on/off solenoid is used, is 0% when the wastegate is commanded off (allow full boost), 100% when commanded on (dump boost). If a vacuum solenoid is duty cycled, the duty cycle from 0 to 100% is displayed. If a linear or stepper motor valve is used, the fully closed position (full boost) is displayed as 0%, the fully open position (dump boost) is displayed as 100%. Intermediate positions are displayed as a percent of the full-open position. Any other actuation method is normalized to display 0% when the WG is commanded off and 100% when the WG is commanded on.

signals.name: Wastegate A position
signals.description: If an on/off solenoid is used, is 0% when the wastegate is commanded off (allow full boost), 100% when commanded on (dump boost). If a vacuum solenoid is duty cycled, the duty cycle from 0 to 100% is displayed. If a linear or stepper motor valve is used, the fully closed position (full boost) is displayed as 0%, the fully open position (dump boost) is displayed as 100%. Intermediate positions are displayed as a percent of the full-open position. Any other actuation method is normalized to display 0% when the WG is commanded off and 100% when the WG is commanded on.

If a linear or stepper motor valve is used, the fully closed position (full boost) is displayed as 0%, the fully open position (dump boost) is displayed as 100%. If a linear or stepper motor valve is used, the fully closed position (full boost) is displayed as 0%, the fully open position (dump boost) is displayed as 100%. Intermediate positions are displayed as a percent of the full-open position. Any other actuation method is normalized to display 0% when the WG is commanded off and 100% when the WG is commanded on.
